explanation:
Provide the minimal declarations/definitions needed to determine if any pointer in OS_SocketListen could be const-qualified:

- OS_stream_internal_record_t: definition of the struct (fields socket_domain, socket_type, stream_state). Required to see which members are read vs written (stream->stream_state is written here), which directly affects whether the stream pointer can be const.
- OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET: macro/function used to obtain the stream pointer from OS_stream_table and token. Must see its expansion/return type to know whether it yields a pointer-to-const or pointer-to-nonconst (and whether it performs any cast that would affect const correctness).
- OS_stream_table: declaration/type of the object table used by OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET; needed to understand the constness of the table entries returned.
- OS_object_token_t: type of token (and whether it is an integer or pointer type). Required because token is passed by address to other functions; knowing its type helps determine whether those functions should take a const pointer.
- OS_ObjectIdGetById: prototype/definition to know the type/signature of the token out-parameter and whether it initializes/modifies token (affects whether token parameter could be const in callers).
- OS_SocketListen_Impl: prototype to know how token is consumed (pointer or const pointer) and whether it modifies the token; needed to check whether &token should be const when passed.
- OS_ObjectIdRelease: prototype to know whether it modifies the token when passed by address (likely consumes it). This affects whether &token must be non-const.
- OS_ObjectIndexFromToken: used (directly or via OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET) to index the table; its signature and return type affect how the table macro produces the pointer and any const propagation.
- OS_SocketDomain_INVALID, OS_SocketType_STREAM: enum/macros that identify socket domain/type; needed to confirm that these checks only read stream fields (helping determine mutability requirements).
- OS_STREAM_STATE_BOUND, OS_STREAM_STATE_LISTENING, OS_STREAM_STATE_CONNECTED: macros for bitflags used on stream_state; needed to confirm read vs write usage and the field is modified (stream_state |= ...), which prevents making the stream pointer point to const data.
- OS_LOCK_MODE_EXCLUSIVE, LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE: constants used in the OS_ObjectIdGetById call; include to fully resolve the prototype/usage of that function.
- OS_SUCCESS, OS_ERR_INCORRECT_OBJ_TYPE, OS_ERR_INCORRECT_OBJ_STATE: return-code constants to understand control flow (when stream is modified) and confirm whether the code path that writes stream->stream_state is executed.

Collecting these symbols (types, macros, prototypes, and table/macro definitions) lets the next analyst determine if any pointer in OS_SocketListen (notably the stream pointer and the &token arguments) could legally and safely be declared as pointing to const-qualified data under MISRA C guidance.
